definition: the act of singing, cause to be tense and uneasy or nervous or anxious
details:
noun
- the act of singing
= synonyms: song
- an intense or violent exertion
= synonyms: straining
- an effortful attempt to attain a goal
= synonyms: striving, nisus, pains
- the general meaning or substance of an utterance
= synonyms: tenor
- a succession of notes forming a distinctive sequence
= synonyms: air
- a special variety of domesticated animals within a species
= synonyms: stock, breed
- (biology) a group of organisms within a species that differ in trivial ways from similar groups
= example: (biology) a group of organisms within a species that differ in trivial ways from similar groups
= synonyms: variant, form
- (physics) deformation of a physical body under the action of applied forces
- injury to a muscle (often caused by overuse)
- nervousness resulting from mental stress
= example: nervousness resulting from mental stress
= synonyms: mental strain, nervous strain
- difficulty that causes worry or emotional tension
= example: difficulty that causes worry or emotional tension
= synonyms: stress
verb
- cause to be tense and uneasy or nervous or anxious
= synonyms: tense, tense up
- alter the shape of (something) by stress
= synonyms: deform, distort
- to exert much effort or energy
= example: to exert much effort or energy
= synonyms: reach
- use to the utmost
= synonyms: extend
- rub through a strainer or process in an electric blender
= synonyms: puree
- remove by passing through a filter
= synonyms: filter, filtrate, separate out, filter out
- separate by passing through a sieve or other straining device to separate out coarser elements
= synonyms: sieve, sift
- become stretched or tense or taut
= synonyms: tense
- test the limits of
= synonyms: try, stress
